s.text: As Prudie's hero Henry David Thoreau observed, "Some circumstantial evidence is very strong, as when you find a trout in the milk."
Her stepping out then forbidding you to do so, even though she is an unwilling sex partner, makes her sound like a perfect candidate for the single life.
You are fixated on an activity that you feel is verboten but which, in fact, is normal.
Whether the Department of Justice thinks it is legal or not, do you think Microsoft is being rude by installing the browser without asking?
In my opinion, raising race as the motivation behind the neighbors' complaints, in the absence of evidence to support the charge, is quite reckless.
